I think the real solution to the (broken) class loader is to fix it so  
that it only searches a more narrowly specified classpath when loading  
test classes, delegating loading of all other classes to the app class  
loader (or some other suitably defined parent).

The custom class loader doesn't even have to "preload" the test  
classes, since its parent will not find the test classes in question.   
As long as a new instance is used for each test case, you will have a  
fresh load of the class under test on each run.

A URLClassLoader might even be sufficient for this purpose.

If I get some time I'll submit a patch, since I'm using a similar  
solution for the abbot junit extension...

On Monday, November 4, 2002, at 01:57 AM, Chris wrote:

> Here's a weird error and the solution, so that the next poor shmuck
> can find it:
>
> When running a junit test suite via Ant, I got this error:
> [junit] loader constraints violated when linking
> org/xml/sax/InputSource class
>
> This appeas to be the same problem with junit's custom class loader
> that is widely documented, and solved by adding
> excluded.6=org.w3c.dom.* and excluded.7=org.xml.sax.* to the file
> excluded.properties. Only problem is, I already have those lines.
>
> The root of the problem for me was that I had jrun.jar in my
> classpath. jrun.jar is an 8 meg monster that comes with JRun4 and
> includes its own copy of the sax classes. Taking jrun.jar out of my
> classpath solved the problem and the tests ran fine.
>
> If anyone happens to know why, I'd like to hear it.
